purpose: To select Team USA representatives for the 2026 Milano Cortina Olympic Winter Games

items.title: “Once An Olympic City, Always An Olympic City”
items.excerpt: The city of St. Louis is currently playing a high-profile role in this year’s Olympics. Through Jan. 11, the Gateway City plays host to the Prevagen U.S. Figure Skating Championships at the Enterprise Center — and skaters from the Kirkwood-Webster Groves area couldn’t be more excited about it. Roughly 90 of the top skaters from around the country will compete

items.title: Lois Ann (Goldman) Weir-Jungers
items.excerpt: Weir-Jungers, Lois Ann (Goldman), age 80, of Kirkwood, Missouri, passed away peacefully at her home on Dec. 24, 2025, after a battle with Alzheimer’s. Lois was born in St. Louis on June 12, 1945, to Joseph and May Goldman. She attended Harris Teachers College and taught public school for many years. One of the most fulfilling chapters of her career

items.title: Glennon W. Travers
items.excerpt: Travers, Glennon W., beloved husband, father, grandfather, brother, brother-in-law, uncle, nephew, cousin, mentor and friend, passed away on Saturday, Dec. 27, 2025, surrounded by the legacy of a life boldly and joyfully lived. Glen was the devoted husband of Elizabeth Ann “Libby” (Snyders) Travers and the loving son of Robert J. Travers and Regina (Charlier) Travers. He was a cherished

items.title: Joan Scheidegger Todd
items.excerpt: Todd, Joan Scheidegger, 82, of Kirkwood, Missouri, passed away peacefully on Dec. 21, 2025. Born on Dec. 1, 1943, Joan was a lifelong resident of Kirkwood who touched the lives of all who knew her. After graduating from Kirkwood High School, Joan began her career as a clothing model for The Grove Company and a shoe model for Edison Brothers

items.title: Edwin Henry “Scott” Schmidt III M.D.
items.excerpt: Schmidt III M.D., Edwin Henry “Scott,” age 75, of Kirkwood, Missouri, passed away on Jan. 3, 2026, at home with his family. items.title: Robert Miller
items.excerpt: Miller, Robert. After a long and fulfilling life, Robert Miller died peacefully in his bed on Dec. 23, 2025. The cause was congestive heart failure. He was 82 years old. Robert was born on Aug. 9, 1943, in Minneapolis, Minnesota, to Mast C. and Mary A. (Rottman) Miller. Shortly after his birth, the family moved to rural Ohio, where his

items.title: Katharine Michelle Miller
items.excerpt: Miller, Katharine Michelle. It is with heavy hearts that we announce the passing of Katharine Michelle Miller, known to many as Michelle. Michelle was born Oct. 21, 1969, and transitioned out of life in Dec. 2025. Michelle is survived by her beloved daughter, Katharine Diane Redington; and her former spouse, Jeff Redington. Michelle was the daughter of the late Danny

items.title: Dorothy Schinzing Miller
items.excerpt: Miller, Dorothy Schinzing, of Kirkwood, Missouri, passed away peacefully at home on Dec. 28, 2025. Born on Dec. 31, 1942, in Des Peres, Missouri, Dorothy spent her life deeply rooted in the community she loved, where she was a lifelong member of St. Paul’s Lutheran Church. She cherished her childhood in Des Peres, growing up alongside her family at the
